channel.title: Eritque Arcus Math Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Eritque Arcus Math Notes

item.title: LU factorization
item.description: factorizing by A = LU where L is lower triangular and U is upper triangular matrix.

item.title: systems of first order ODEs
item.description: \vec x' = A\vec x briefly we need to find all Eigenvectors: find all Eigenvalues of the coefficient matrix A by solving \det(A - \lambda I) for each \lambda_i find (A - \lambda_i I)\vec \xi_i = \vec 0 where I is identify matrix and \vec\xi_i is correspond Eigenvector if the \lambda_i is repeate...

item.title: Abel's identity
item.description: for y'' + p(t) y' + q(t) y = 0 W(t) = W(y_1, \dots, y_n)(t) = c e^{-\int p(t)dt} where W is Wronskian determinant and c is a constant by W at convenient point.

item.title: readme
item.description: This note is outcome of SP 2025 MATH 441. Differential Equations in UIUC, taught by professor Nikolaos Tzirakis.

item.title: reduction of Order
item.description: find another linearly independent solution based on a known solution known y_1(t) as solution, take y_2(t) = u(t)y_1(t) as new solution.

item.title: exact equations
item.description: For a differential equation M(x,y)dx + N(x,y)dy = 0 we will say itâ€™s exact if and only if \frac{\partial M}{dy} = \frac{\partial N}{dx}.

item.title: variation of parameters
item.description: \begin{equation*}\begin{aligned} y' + p(t)y &= 0\\ y'\frac{1}{y} &= - p(t)\\ (\ln|y|)' &= -p(t)\\ y &= Ce^{-\int p(t) dt} \end{aligned}\end{equation*}.

item.title: integrating factor
item.description: For \frac{dy}{dt} + p(t)y(t) = g(t) consider a \mu(t) that \mu\frac{dy}{dt} + \mu p(t)y(t) = \mu g(t) take \frac{d\mu}{dt} = \mu p(t) \implies \mu = Ce^{p(t)t} therefore, we can turn the equation above to \frac{d}{dt}(\mu y) = \mu g(t) \implies y = \frac{\int \mu g(t) dt + C}{\mu} then plug \mu in a...

item.title: fundamental set
item.description: a set of solutions for the specific differential equation every solution should be linear combination of this.

item.title: solution difference
item.description: a technique in solving, theorem 3.5.1 in the book .
